A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Enjoyable\, complex\, passionate\, brilliant\, flawed.

Despite (and perhaps because) I entered the cinema with such low expectations for The Last Jedi\, I was thoroughly blown away by the film's majesty. For one\, cinematographically\, The Last Jedi is beautiful. The camera work is visually compelling and invites one to sit deep in their seats\, huddled with excitement and wonder. The score adds to this feeling exponentially.
With humor only sometimes off-key\, it's jokes let me relate and shake my head at the same time. Overall\, The Last Jedis light-heartedness does not detract from the dark and propelling themes that follow it. There's a lot to be said\, and done\, and shown in the mere two hours we get\, and they try. I cannot claim that the saga was given direction by this film\, but it was certainly given depth and I fear for its ending because it deserves a good one.
